title: Everything you need to know about the NA LCS Spring Playoffs

replies.body: #C9Loyal

More nervous about TIP than CLG or TSM right now, but I still believe.

**#C9WIN**
Sadly, I don't think C9 will win this one. While I am a Cloud 9 fan, and I know they have the talent to win, I just can't picture them beating TSM in a Bo5.
That's why C9 are the best at Bo5's in NA
As much as I love C9, that's actually not true. TSM has proven over and -over- that they are the best at it. I couldn't tell you why or how, but they always manage to get there in game 5.

TSM IMHO seems to always do well if they are behind. That is both for a single game  and a bo5. They keep calm and look for mistakes their competition makes. I would compare them to the GE tigers in that sense as from what I've seen from GET is they play calm and strike suddenly switching both a game and a bo series.
C9 Win it all baby
Amen Brother
we will see if C9 can shake off IEM
#Number 1!

They need to win all 4, Winterfox to lose all 4, and a tie breaker against winterfox JUST TO FINISH 9TH
i want WFX to stay in LCS. I like Pobelter and Altec. I hope they go back to the original roster. Paragon was pretty lackluster.
They are I think. Personally a big fan of Gleeb (who I believe is coming back as well) Paragon was just not as impressive as the Altec/Gleeb combo bot

Everything i learned is NA LCS will be playing their finals in the LCS studio instead of a large arena audience like it deserves.

> [{quoted}](name=Wrath of Kon,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=mn9Grtx3,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-03-20T16:42:40.316+0000)
>
> Everything i learned is NA LCS will be playing their finals in the LCS studio instead of a large arena audience like it deserves.

It makes sense though... would've been too expensive to travel the crew TWICE in a very short time(roadshows for this type of thing are absurdly expensive) - once for the spring finals and then AGAIN for the mid-season invitational not too long after. Mid-season Invitational is obviously the larger of the two events so it makes sense to travel for that and hold the finals at home.

> [{quoted}](name=Eleshakai,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=mn9Grtx3,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-03-21T16:10:18.330+0000)
>
> It makes sense though... would've been too expensive to travel the crew TWICE in a very short time(roadshows for this type of thing are absurdly expensive) - once for the spring finals and then AGAIN for the mid-season invitational not too long after. Mid-season Invitational is obviously the larger of the two events so it makes sense to travel for that and hold the finals at home.

except EU goes to madrid.... Riots a billion dollar a year company.... we should quit acting like 1 event is going to bankrupt them! they are rolling in Dough

> [{quoted}](name=Wrath of Kon,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=mn9Grtx3,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-03-21T17:35:45.574+0000)
>
> except EU goes to madrid.... Riots a billion dollar a year company.... we should quit acting like 1 event is going to bankrupt them! they are rolling in Dough

So yes, each region is hosting ONE abroad event. Mid-season is in NA, so the NA team is hosting it. EU team is hosting their finals abroad. I would wager that the next time an international event happens in EU, their local regional event will happen at the studio. 

It's not just about money though, it's expensive in TIME too. Planning two events like this that close together would be an absurd burden and lead to the events likely being shoddy which none of us want. That's why they're doing ONE abroad event for each of the two largest regions during this time. Then at finals team each place will have one abroad event as well I suspect.

> [{quoted}](name=Eleshakai,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=mn9Grtx3,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-21T18:53:58.913+0000)
>
> So yes, each region is hosting ONE abroad event. Mid-season is in NA, so the NA team is hosting it. EU team is hosting their finals abroad. I would wager that the next time an international event happens in EU, their local regional event will happen at the studio. 
> 
> It's not just about money though, it's expensive in TIME too. Planning two events like this that close together would be an absurd burden and lead to the events likely being shoddy which none of us want. That's why they're doing ONE abroad event for each of the two largest regions during this time. Then at finals team each place will have one abroad event as well I suspect.

its not really that absurd.... you can easily have 2 teams work on 2 different assignments. Second MSI is a international event not a NA event. So EU should have to be in their studios for summer at all points because they have worlds with this logic.

**TSM WILL BE NUMBER ONE FTW**
TSM will be NA Champions once again! Going to get a cool 90 pts too.
Not a snowball's chance in hell TSM loses 3 games to anyone. Until someone can figure out a way to stop Bjergsen and turtle, it's just not going to happen.

Lots of C9 fans here. Personally i think TSM are the team to beat with TIP as the darkhorse. Wouldn't be surprise to see them in the finals if TIP can get those solo queueish moments out of their game. WIll be interesting to see how CLG and C9 do as well considering they're having a bit of an up and down moment.
